Step 3: Draw the curves * On face 1, draw a circle with a center at [0.1375, 0.6125] and a radius of 0.1375. * On face 2, draw a line from [0.0005, 0.6004] to [0.0462, 0.0836]. * On face 2, draw an arc starting at [0.0462, 0.0836] with a midpoint at [0.1375, 0.1833] and ending at [0.2288, 0.0836]. * On face 2, draw a line from [0.2288, 0.0836] to [0.2745, 0.6004]. * On face 2, draw an arc starting at [0.2745, 0.6004] with a midpoint at [0.1375, 0.475] and ending at [0.0005, 0.6004]. * On face 3, draw a circle with a center at [0.1375, 0.0917] and a radius of 0.0917. Step 4: Constrain the loops * Face 1, loop 1: The circle should be closed. * Face 2, loop 1: The loop should be closed, with the end point of line 2 connecting to the start point of line 1. * Face 3, loop 1: The circle should be closed. Step 5: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Step 6: Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch Use the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Step 7: Extrude the 2D sketch Extrude the 2D sketch by a depth of 0.0183 towards the normal and 0.0 in the opposite direction of the normal. This will create the final 3D model. Step 8: Describe the CAD part The CAD part is a rectangular prism with a curved top edge, with a length and width of 0.75 and a height of 0.0183.</description>

<json>
